intro: Ruyschiana heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf ruyschiana, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its variable leaf morphology, which can range from narrow and linear to broad and ovate. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
